Description: Body sherd of Corinthian black-figured pottery closed vessel, possibly an olpe; glaze fired red-brown; exterior: decoration consisting of parts of nine rows of double incised glazed black scales with central dots and traces of dots in added red within each scale; below, traces of bands in added white and red; below, part of undetermined black figure decoration.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For parallels regarding the scales, see British Museum 1924,1201.1219 and Boardman 1998, 193, no. 381.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.064) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
